author: Staff Reporter
text:
A portion of the properties of an emu firm named Weltex India Private Limited that duped hundreds of investors will be auctioned in Coimbatore on January 7 and 8. Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP) of the Economic Offences Wing (EOW)–II in Coimbatore C. Thambidurai said that the firm started a supermarket at Hope College and a textile unit at Arasur.

Properties that will be auctioned at the South Taluk Office on Thursday are hotel equipment, racks and garments worth a total base value of Rs. 6.03 lakh that are available in the supermarket. On Friday, textiles garments with a base value of Rs. 5.15 lakh at the textile unit at Arasur will be auctioned at the Sulur Taluk Office.

Interested persons could have a look of the products to be auctioned on a day ahead of the auction through the respective Tahsildars. The said properties are auctioned based on directions of the TNPID Court in Coimbatore. For details, call DSP Thambidurai at 9498173580.
title: Properties of emu firm to be auctioned
